content.question: The second derivative of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f double prime of x, equals, the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator x squared, and denominator 8, close parenthesis, minus 2 times cosine x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has many critical points, two of which are at <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 6.949" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.949</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a local minimum at <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and at <math alttext="x equals 6.949" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.949</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a local minimum at <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and a local maximum at <math alttext="x equals 6.949" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.949</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a local maximum at <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and a local minimum at <math alttext="x equals 6.949" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.949</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a local maximum at <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and at <math alttext="x equals 6.949" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.949</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a local maximum at <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and at <math alttext="x equals 6.949" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6.949</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
